parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Slurm",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "SES-Adapter",
    "partition": "NvidiaA800",
    "node": "ZSGPU18",
    "tasks_per_node": 1,
    "gpu_per_node": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 16,
    "memory": "100G",
    "time": "180-00:00:00",
    "output_file": "/public/home/tanyang/workspace/SES-Adapter/log/%j.out",
    "error_file": "/public/home/tanyang/workspace/SES-Adapter/log/%j.err",
    "conda_environment": "protssn",
    "python_script": "train.py",
    "plm_model": "ckpt/$plm_model",
    "num_attention_heads": 8,
    "pooling_method": "$pooling_method",
    "pooling_dropout": 0.1,
    "dataset_config": "dataset/$dataset/"$dataset"_"$pdb_type".json",
    "learning_rate": "5e-4",
    "num_workers": 4,
    "gradient_accumulation_steps": 1,
    "max_train_epochs": 50,
    "max_batch_token": 120000,
    "patience": 5,
    "ckpt_root": "result",
    "ckpt_dir": "$plm_model/$dataset",
    "model_name": "wofsss_"$pdb_type"_"$pooling_method"_5e-4.pt",
    "wandb": true,
    "wandb_entity": "ty_ang",
    "wandb_project": "adapter",
    "wandb_run_name": "wofsss_"$plm_model"_"$pdb_type"_"$pooling_method"_5e-4"
  }
}
```

The script utilizes Slurm as a job scheduler. It requests a specific node with a GPU and sets up environment variables related to NCCL and OpenMP. It runs a Python script called "train.py" within a conda environment called "protssn". This script appears to be related to protein structure analysis, leveraging a pre-trained language model for some task (like classification or prediction). It leverages Weights & Biases for logging and experiment tracking.
